title: Turkish airlines flight makes safe landing at BIA
byline: A Turkish Airlines passenger flight safely landed at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake last night after reporting a landing gear malfunction, airport officials confirmed.

title: BIA on standby as Turkish Airlines flight reports landing gear issue
byline: The runway at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake has been readied for an emergency landing after a Turkish Airlines passenger flight reported a landing gear malfunction, airport officials confirmed.

title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
byline: Paris St-Germain have been ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

title: Goods train successfully operates from China Bay to Seeduwa
byline: A goods train operated successfully from China Bay to Seeduwa today, despite disruptions to rail services on the Eastern Line caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the Railways Department said.

title: Sri Lanka Unveil T20I Squad for India Tour Ahead of Women’s World Cup 2026
byline: Sri Lanka have announced a 15-member squad for their upcoming five-match Women’s T20 International series against India, marking an important step in their preparations for the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup 2026 in England.

title: Japan extends $2.5 million emergency grant to Sri Lanka
byline: The Japanese government has decided to provide an emergency grant of $2.5 million to Sri Lanka following the devastation caused by a cyclone that struck the country in late November, Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Tuesday.

title: Pathum Nissanka picked by Delhi Capitals for INR 4 Crore
byline: Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka has been signed by the Delhi Capitals for INR 4 crore at the IPL 2026 player auction held in Abu Dhabi.

title: Pramodya Wickramasinghe appointed chairman of National Cricket Selection Committee
byline: Pramodya Wickramasinghe has been appointed as the Chairman of the National Cricket Selection Committee.

title: NPP-led Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget defeated by one vote
byline: The inaugural budget of the Balapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), was defeated at a council meeting held today.

title: Red landslide warnings lifted; amber alerts extended
byline: Previously issued Level 3 (Red) landslide warnings have been lifted, while Level 2 (Amber) and Level 1 (Yellow) warnings have been extended in several districts after authorities reviewed current ground conditions and recent rainfall.

title: Trump under fire for ‘loathsome’ post about death of Rob Reiner and wife
byline: President Donald Trump is under fire over his comments on the deaths of legendary Hollywood director and actor Rob Reiner, 78, and his wife Michele Singer Reiner, 68, who were found fatally stabbed at their Los Angeles home Sunday.

title: Rains return as country battles to recover from Ditwah
byline: Showery weather has returned to several parts of the country, with the Meteorology Department warning that rain will continue over the Northern and Eastern regions during the next few days under the influence of an Easterly wave.

title: KKR Splash ₹18 Crore on Matheesha Pathirana at IPL 2026 Auction
byline: Sri Lankan pace sensation Matheesha Pathirana landed a blockbuster deal at the IPL 2026 auction, with Kolkata Knight Riders snapping him up for a massive ₹18 crore.

title: Wanindu Hasaranga Joins LSG for IPL 2026 at ₹2 Crore
byline: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) have snapped up Sri Lankan spin star Wanindu Hasaranga at the IPL 2026 Mini Auction, securing the all-rounder for ₹2.00 crore.

title: Police release suspect photo in Mahawa shop burglaries
byline: Mahawa Police have released a photograph of a suspect wanted in connection with recent shop burglaries in the area.

title: Create Ministry for disaster management: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to create a Ministry for disaster management to be in charge of preventing and managing disasters.

title: Probe launched into police action involving Ranwala’s accident: Nalinda
byline: Investigation has been launched into whether there had been any negligence of duties or delays in implementing the law on the part of the police when taking action against the road accident involving former Speaker MP Ashoka Ranwala, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Government pledges continued support for mothers and children
byline: Even amid challenging circumstances, the government remains committed to investing in mothers and children, Women and Child Affairs Minister Saroja Savithri Paulraj said today.

title: Cabinet approves expansion of medical supply storage
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal to expand the storage capacity of the Medical Supply Division, which operates under the Health and Mass Media Ministry.

title: Six Thai women arrested in Kollupitiya brothel
byline: Six Thai nationals were arrested after police raided a brothel allegedly operating under the guise of a spa in Kollupitiya.

title: Cabinet approves commemorative stamps for 50 years of Sri Lanka–Saudi ties
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to issue two commemorative stamps celebrating the 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia.

title: Cabinet approves release of Yala paddy stocks to market
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved steps to mill and release paddy stocks purchased during the last Yala season by the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) using funds allocated for 2025.

title: Cabinet approves key appointments in state departments
byline: The Cabinet Ministers has approved appointments to two senior positions in Sri Lanka’s state administrative services, following recent vacancies.

title: Judicial digitalisation project gets Cabinet nod
byline: The Government has identified the digitalisation of Sri Lanka’s judicial system as a national priority, with the aim of improving efficiency, transparency and access to justice.

title: NPP will take disciplinary action against Ranwala if he has cheated on doctorate: Nalinda
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) will take disciplinary action against former Speaker Ashoka Ranwala if he has cheated on his doctorate, Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Passenger arrested at BIA with Rs. 285,000 cigarettes
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger attempting to smuggle a consignment of foreign-made cigarettes valued at Rs. 285,000 through the Green Channel at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) was arrested by airport Customs officers this morning.

title: Trump files $5bn defamation lawsuit against BBC over Panorama speech edit
byline: US President Donald Trump has filed a $5bn (£3.7bn) lawsuit against the BBC over an edit of his 6 January 2021 speech in a Panorama documentary.

title: Sri Lanka Ambassador meets Bahrain crown prince
byline: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Bahrain, Shanika Dissanayake, met His Royal Highness Prince Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa, Crown Prince and Prime Minister of Bahrain, at the Gudaibiya Palace in Manama on Sunday (14).

title: Indian aid ship arrives in Colombo after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Another ship carrying Indian humanitarian assistance under Operation Sagar Bandhu has arrived at the Colombo Port to support Sri Lanka’s relief efforts following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Security beefed up for Ashes Adelaide Test after Bondi shooting
byline: Police armed with rifles will be part of a beefed up security presence at the third Test between Australia and England at Adelaide Oval after the Bondi Beach shooting attacks, officials said, while flags will be flown at half-mast.

title: Police beef up security at religious sites
byline: The Inspector General of Police (IGP) has instructed all Senior DIGs and DIGs to take necessary measures to maintain law and order and ensure a peaceful environment during the upcoming festive season, with special focus on religious sites.

title: Trump expands US travel ban to five more countries
byline: President Donald Trump has expanded a US travel ban, barring nationals of five additional countries and people travelling on Palestinian Authority-issued documents from entering the US.

title: Chinese NPC Vice Chairman arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Wang Dongming, Vice Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People’s Congress (NPC) of the People’s Republic of China, arrived in Sri Lanka yesterday for a three-day official visit.

title: Construction sector momentum continues with 12.2% growth in 3Q
byline: The Sri Lankan construction sector recorded a robust double-digit growth of 12.2 percent in the third quarter of 2025, maintaining its recovery momentum and catalysing broader activity across the real estate and professional services sectors.

title: EU delivers €5million disaster relief to Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka received a significant boost to its disaster relief operations on December 17, as a special cargo plane from Germany and Luxembourg landed at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) carrying 69,000 kilograms of essential supplies valued at €5 million.

title: IRD records highest-ever revenue, surpasses 2025 target
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has generated additional tax revenue of Rs. 50 billion, surpassing its 2025 revenue target of Rs. 2,195 billion, and recording the highest revenue performance in its recent history.

title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
byline: Paris St-Germain have been ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

title: Parliament to debate disaster situation tomorrow
byline: Parliament is set to debate the current disaster situation tomorrow, according to a decision taken by party leaders, the Office of the Leader of the House said today.

title: Youth who confronted Namal in Matale surrenders
byline: A youth who confronted Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa during his visit to disaster-affected residents in Matale yesterday later surrendered after explaining his concerns.

title: R. Sridhar appointed Sri Lanka National Team fielding coach
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) said that R. Sridhar has been appointed as the Fielding Coach of the Sri Lanka National Team, effective until the completion of the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup.

title: Pope Leo XIV appoints new Bishop for Anuradhapura
byline: Pope Leo XIV  has appointed Fr. Nishantha Sagara Jayamanne as the new Bishop of the Anuradhapura Diocese, the Catholic Church of Sri Lanka announced today.

title: NMRA orders temporary withdrawal of 10 medicines until safety checks completed
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) has directed local hospitals to temporarily stop using ten medicinal products until their manufacturing processes are verified to meet required standards, NMRA Chairman Dr. Ananda Wijewickrama said.

title: Ondansetron suspended over quality concerns: GMOA
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) announced that the use of a specific batch of the drug Ondansetron, commonly used to prevent vomiting, has been suspended in Sri Lanka due to quality concerns.

title: Sri Lanka’s youth environmental resolution adopted at UNEA-7
byline: Sri Lanka’s draft resolution on enhancing youth participation in environmental processes and education has been adopted at the Seventh Session of the United Nations Environment Assembly (UNEA-7) in Nairobi.

title: Injured wild elephant burnt alive in Mihintale
byline: A wild elephant found lying in a home garden at Seeppukulama in Mihintale died yesterday afternoon after being set on fire with burning torches, wildlife officials said.

title: Fifa brings in new £45 ticket for 2026 World Cup
byline: Fifa has introduced a small number of ’’more affordable’’ $60 (£45) tickets for all 104 matches at the 2026 World Cup following criticism of its pricing structure for the tournament.

title: Probe launched into Ondansetron batch after deaths, use suspended
byline: The investigations are underway into a batch of the anaesthesia-related drug Ondansetron, following reports of two deaths that raised concerns over its safety, Deputy Minister of Health Hansaka Wijemuni said.

title: 15-hour water cut in Mahara and Gampaha today for maintenance work
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 15-hour water disruption in the Mahara and Gampaha Pradeshiya Sabha areas today (17).

title: Trump under fire for ‘loathsome’ post about death of Rob Reiner and wife
byline: President Donald Trump is under fire over his comments on the deaths of legendary Hollywood director and actor Rob Reiner, 78, and his wife Michele Singer Reiner, 68, who were found fatally stabbed at their Los Angeles home Sunday.

title: Sajith discusses disaster issues with UN Resident Coordinator
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa discussed Sri Lanka’s issues pertaining to the disaster situation with UN Resident Coordinator Mark Andre Franche today.

title: AI romance blooms as Japanese woman weds virtual partner of her dream
byline: Music played in a wedding hall in western Japan as Yurina Noguchi, wearing a white gown and tiara, dabbed away her tears, taking in the words of her husband-to-be: an AI-generated persona gazing out from a smartphone screen.

title: Notice on false information
byline: The Presidential Secretariat warned the public about a misleading news item circulating on social media under the title “Rapid Complaint Handling Procedure for Irregularities Involving Grama Niladhari,” stating that it is false and deceptive.

title: Ditwah reduces over 13,000 houses to rubble
byline: The total number of houses completely destroyed across Sri Lanka by the calamity triggered by Cyclone Ditwah has surpassed 13,000, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Shock as popular South African DJ shot dead in Johannesburg
byline: A popular South African radio and club DJ has been shot dead in the country’s largest city, Johannesburg, sending shockwaves across the nation grappling with entrenched crime.

title: Man fined for illegal possession of baby crocodile in Aluthgama
byline: Hikkaduwa Wildlife Officers arrested a 44-year-old man in the Kaluwamodara area of Aluthgama today (16) for illegally possessing a baby crocodile, according to the Hikkaduwa National Park Headquarters.

title: Naveed Akram charged with 15 counts of murder over Bondi shooting
byline: Naveed Akram, the surviving suspect in Sunday’s mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney, has been charged with 59 offences, including 15 counts of murder and one of committing a terrorist act, according to the New South Wales Police.

title: Japan grants US$ 2.5 million to support Sri Lanka’s post-cyclone recovery
byline: Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Herath today accepted a grant of US$ 2.5 million from the Government of Japan to support Sri Lanka’s ongoing recovery and rebuilding efforts following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Missing yellow anaconda calf found at Dehiwala Zoo after 10 days
byline: The yellow anaconda calf that went missing from the Dehiwala National Zoo on December 6 has been found after a 10-day search, Deputy Director of the zoo Kasun Hemantha Samarasekara said.

title: RW ready to advice government on disaster management: Thalatha
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is ready to provide advice to the government on disaster management if needed, but neither he nor the others in the UNP intend to take up any positions, United National Party (UNP) General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala said today.

title: Prison officers fire warning shots to foil escape attempt
byline: Officers of the Galle Prison opened fire into the air after two inmates attempted to escape from the prison, prison authorities said.

title: Turkish Airlines flight resumes journey after technical issue at BIA
byline: The Turkish Airlines flight from Colombo to Istanbul, which was forced to return to Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) due to a technical issue with its landing gear, departed again this evening after repairs were completed, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited said.

title: Army restores Nayaru Bridge, collapsed by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Sri Lanka Army Engineers have restored connectivity following the complete collapse of the Nayaru main bridge in Mullaitivu, which was severely damaged by intense flooding caused by Cyclone Ditwah recently.

title: India confers highest award of Bharat Scouts and Guides to Janaprith Fernando
byline: Sri Lanka’s Chief Scout Commissioner Janaprith Salinda Fernando was awarded the ’Silver Elephant Award’ at the Raj Bhawan in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India by the Governor Amandi Ben Patel recently.

title: Doctors strike at Anuradhapura, Badulla hospitals over security concerns
byline: Doctors at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital launched a strike this morning, citing serious concerns over their personal safety following the discovery of several empty bullet casings within the hospital premises earlier this week.

title: Kuliyapitiya Crimes OIC transferred after assault video goes viral
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Crimes Branch of the Kuliyapitiya Police Station has been transferred with immediate effect following the circulation of a video on social media showing an assault involving the officer.

title: Landslide threatens nine-arch railway bridge tourist zone
byline: The Central Cultural Fund (CCF) has warned that the area around the nine-arch Railway Bridge in Modara, a popular spot for both local and foreign tourists, is under threat of landslide due to adverse weather caused by the cyclone ’’Ditwa’’.

title: Mother, son killed in three-wheeler-bus collision
byline: A mother and a son were killed while two others were injured when a three-wheeler collided head-on with a private bus at Muwagammana in Dehiattakandiya this afternoon.

title: Hackers access Pornhub’s premium users’ viewing habits and search history
byline: Hackers have accessed the search history and viewing habits of premium users of Pornhub, one of the world’s most popular pornography websites.
